newsitem.title: USA: No reason US economy can't grow 4 more years - Reich.
newsitem.headline: No reason US economy can't grow 4 more years - Reich.

text.p: U.S. Labor Secretary Robert Reich said Tuesday he saw no reason why the current five-year-plus economic expansion cannot continue for another four years.
He suggested that growth could be stronger than the Administration has conservatively forecast.
"We ought to be able to keep the economy going," Reich told Reuters Financial Television. "I don't see why it (the expansion) can't continue (for another four more years)."
He added that he saw no sign of an acceleration in inflation despite the economy's continued strong performance.
Reich spoke from Clinton's headquarters in Little Rock amid mounting signs that the president was on his way to winning another four years in office.

The Labor Secretary set out three economic policy priorities for a second Clinton term -- reducing the budget deficit, opening up foreign markets to U.S. exports, and investing in education and training.

He strongly denied that Clinton would back away from his pledge to balance the federal budget by the year 2002. "I believe we are going to get there," Reich said in response to a question. "It's good for the markets and it's good for America," he added.

The administration has projected that the economy will grow by 2.3 percent next year and beyond. But Reich called that forecast "very conservative. Maybe we can grow faster," he said. Much will depend on the growth of productivity.
